Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Thanks for working on this!

Would you mind also updating the doc/source/policies.rst so that the different policies in this example would be covered and explained there and add DocImpact to the commit message?

Having the docs updated would greatly improve the value of the example as one could reflect what they see in the example without knowing the internals. Also having the reference to the example in the docs would be beneficial.

Patch Set 4:

@Erno sorry for the late response, I was busy with another patch. I'll check that, thanks

Patch Set 4:

@Erno What I understood is that the doc/source/policies.rst is just to give an example on how to set the policy rules, I didn't understand what I could improve there, since the syntax to write the rules is the same.
Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Hi Andre,

The policies.rst has section "Constructing a Policy Configuration File" section that has actions explained. Your example contains lots of actions not listed there and it would be great to have those opened up what they actually affect on.

Flagging the missing "DocImpact" on Commit Message again.

Patch Set 7:

I noticed jenkins failed, I think you hit bug(s):

- check-tempest-dsvm-neutron-full: https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1392860

If you believe we've correctly identified the failure, feel free to leave a 'recheck' comment to run the tests again.
For more details on this and other bugs, please see http://status.openstack.org/elastic-recheck/
Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)

see comment in policy file for cleanup

Patch Set 7:

(2 comments)

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

As for me there are to many "rule:is_cloud_admin or rule:is_project_admin or rule:is_project_member"
Maybe create a single rule for this and make it default?

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-2

I think this change needs more discussion before moved forward:

1) The blueprint linked should have spec written for it. The blueprint description gives different end goal for this change than the related keystone spec ( https://review.openstack.org/#/c/135408/ ).
2) We should not use policies in our examples that are not explained in doc/source/policies.rst. The lack of the documentation gives direct signal to our deployers that they need to go and read the code to understand example, which defeats the purpose of example. This was flagged first time at PS 4.
3) If this change is meant to be cross project implementation of new default roles, this needs to be discussed with wider audience, not just hoping that any of the projects merges it and then using that to get the rest agreeing.

Good next steps:
1) Start the discussion on the dev mailing list what are you actually trying to reach with these changes, how you want to do it and collect feedback.
2) Bring your case to Cross Project and individual project weekly meetings after the wide consensus has been reached. https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings has details of the meetings and their agendas.

Understanding the scale I think this needs to be planned and executed carefully if at all. Thanks for working on this and please understand this is not you. We just need to take step back and approach this right to avoid any cross project conflicts this scale of change might bring.

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

Hey Andre!

Thanks for submitting this. Given the policy working group that ayoung is leading, can we abandon this? I'd like to abandon this in a week or two unless you care to resubmit it. Note that if we abandon this, it can always be restored at a later date.

Cheers,
Ian

Patch Set 7:

I'd recommend continuing on with this review, as I think the glance team needs to understand how policy should look for glance, and use that to feed in to the unified policy effort.  THey are complementary, not at odds.

Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

This patch has been -1ed because it has not been updated in
>=2months. The patch also has either a -1/-2 from a core reviewer or a
-1 from Jenkins.

Please, update/rebase the patch if the lack of updates was actually a
lack of reviews or if you think the patch is still relevant.

**NOTE: This will be abandoned if no update is done in 1 week.**

If this action does not seem accurate, please, ping flaper87 on IRC
and he will gladly revert it. Sorry for the inconvenience and we look
forward to have more contributions from you.

Patch Set 7:

This patch was marked to be abanadoned >=7days ago.

It is now being abandoned because there was no update, feedback nor rebase in the aforementioned period. If this is a mistake, please, contact members of the glance team[0] and they'll promptly correct the error.

Thanks for your contribution. The Glance team looks forward to new contributions from you.
Abandoned
